medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden loss of consciousness while jogging.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient suddenly lost consciousness while jogging. Witnesses observed him arch his back and fall backward to the ground. He was found unconscious and unresponsive to verbal and physical stimulation upon arrival at the emergency department. The duration of the loss of consciousness was initially unclear. During his initial examination, he began to respond to noxious stimuli.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of collapsing while jogging one year earlier and was diagnosed with a 'thickened' heart (hypertrophic cardiomyopathy). He had been advised to refrain from playing soccer and was prescribed a beta-blocker.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother had a 'thickened heart', but there was no reported history of sudden death in the family.
